prompt: <description>Part 1: Three-Dimensional, Rectangular Prism with a Flat Top and Bottom **Step 1: Draw a 2D Sketch** Create a new coordinate system with the following euler angles: x=-90, y=0, z=-90 and translation vector: [0, 0, 0]. In the X-Y plane, draw a rectangle by creating six lines: 1. Line 1: Start Point [0, 0], End Point [0.6, 0] 2. Line 2: Start Point [0.6, 0], End Point [0.6, 0.75] 3. Line 3: Start Point [0.6, 0.75], End Point [0.3, 0.75] 4. Line 4: Start Point [0.3, 0.75], End Point [0.3, 0.3] 5. Line 5: Start Point [0.3, 0.3], End Point [0.0, 0.3] 6. Line 6: Start Point [0.0, 0.3], End Point [0.0, 0.0] **Step 2: Scale the 2D Sketch** Scale the sketch by a factor of 0.75. **Step 3: Transform the 2D Sketch into 3D Sketch** Transform the scaled 2D sketch into 3D by setting the extrusion depth towards the normal to 0.6 and the sketch scale to 0.75. **Step 4: Extrude the 2D Sketch** Extrude the sketch along the Z-axis to create a 3D model of a rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom. The length and width of the prism are 0.6 and 0.75 units respectively, and the height is 0.75 units. Part 2: Three-Dimensional, Rectangular Prism with a Flat Top and Bottom (Cut Feature) **Step 1: Draw a 2D Sketch** Create a new coordinate system with the following euler angles: x=0, y=0, z=0 and translation vector: [0.15, 0.3, 0.75]. In the X-Y plane, draw a square by creating four lines: 1. Line 1: Start Point [0.0, 0.0], End Point [0.3, 0.0] 2. Line 2: Start Point [0.3, 0.0], End Point [0.3, 0.3] 3. Line 3: Start Point [0.3, 0.3], End Point [0.0, 0.3] 4. Line 4: Start Point [0.0, 0.3], End Point [0.0, 0.0] **Step 2: Scale the 2D Sketch** Scale the sketch by a factor of 0.3. **Step 3: Transform the 2D Sketch into 3D Sketch** Transform the scaled 2D sketch into 3D by setting the extrusion depth opposite the normal to 0.15 and the sketch scale to 0.3. **Step 4: Extrude the 2D Sketch** Extrude the sketch along the Z-axis to create a 3D model of a rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom. This will result in a cut feature being applied to the previous part, reducing the size of the prism. The length and width of the prism are approximately 0.3 units each, and the height is 0.15 units.</description>
completion:
<json>
{"parts":{"part_1":{"coordinate_system":{"Euler Angles":[-90.0,0.0,-90.0],"Translation Vector":[0.0,0.0,0.0]},"sketch":{"face_1":{"loop_1":{"line_1":{"Start Point":[0.0,0.0],"End Point":[0.6,0.0]},"line_2":{"Start Point":[0.6,0.0],"End Point":[0.6,0.75]},"line_3":{"Start Point":[0.6,0.75],"End Point":[0.3,0.75]},"line_4":{"Start Point":[0.3,0.75],"End Point":[0.3,0.3]},"line_5":{"Start Point":[0.3,0.3],"End Point":[0.0,0.3]},"line_6":{"Start Point":[0.0,0.3],"End Point":[0.0,0.0]}}}},"extrusion":{"extrude_depth_towards_normal":0.6,"extrude_depth_opposite_normal":0.0,"sketch_scale":0.75,"operation":"NewBodyFeatureOperation"}},"part_2":{"coordinate_system":{"Euler Angles":[0.0,0.0,0.0],"Translation Vector":[0.15,0.3,0.75]},"sketch":{"face_1":{"loop_1":{"line_1":{"Start Point":[0.0,0.0],"End Point":[0.3,0.0]},"line_2":{"Start Point":[0.3,0.0],"End Point":[0.3,0.3]},"line_3":{"Start Point":[0.3,0.3],"End Point":[0.0,0.3]},"line_4":{"Start Point":[0.0,0.3],"End Point":[0.0,0.0]}}}},"extrusion":{"extrude_depth_towards_normal":0.0,"extrude_depth_opposite_normal":0.15,"sketch_scale":0.3,"operation":"CutFeatureOperation"}}}}
</json>

prompt: <description>**Part 1: Construct a rectangular frame with a square opening in the center** Begin by creating a new coordinate system at the origin with no rotation and no translation. For the sketch, create a new face and draw two rectangles, one inside the other. The outer rectangle should have vertices at (0, 0), (0.3618, 0), (0.3618, 0.3618), and (0, 0.3618). The inner rectangle should have vertices at (0.0295, 0.0264), (0.3317, 0.0264), (0.3317, 0.3354), and (0.0295, 0.3354). This results in a square opening in the center of the frame, which is the same size as the frame's width. The first rectangle has 4 lines (line\\_1 to line\\_4). The second rectangle has 4 lines (line\\_1 to line\\_4) as well. The square opening in the center consists of 4 lines (line\\_1 to line\\_4) and is formed by the intersection of the two rectangles. Extrude the sketch along the z-axis by 0.0264 units with no depth offset. **Part 2: Construct a rectangular prism with a curved side** Create a new coordinate system with the same origin as the previous one, a rotation of 0 degrees around all axes, and a translation of (0, 0, 0.0264) to position it relative to the previous part. For the sketch, create a new face and draw a rectangle with vertices at (0, 0), (0.3618, 0), (0.3618, 0.3618), and (0, 0.3618). This forms the base of the prism. Create a new loop and draw an arc with a radius of 0.1809 (half the width of the prism) centered at (0.1809, 0.1809). The arc should span an angle of 180 degrees, effectively creating a curved side of the prism. Extrude the sketch along the z-axis by 0.7236 units with no depth offset. The final shape of the assembly is a rectangular prism with a square opening in the center and a curved side. The prism is positioned at a 45-degree angle, and the hole in the center is cylindrical with a diameter of 1/3 of the prism's width. The prism is 2 units long and 1 unit wide, and the hole is 1 unit deep. The prism is centered in the image.</description>
completion:
<json>
{"parts":{"part_1":{"coordinate_system":{"Euler Angles":[0.0,0.0,0.0],"Translation Vector":[0.0,0.0,0.0]},"sketch":{"face_1":{"loop_1":{"line_1":{"Start Point":[0.0,0.0],"End Point":[0.3618,0.0]},"line_2":{"Start Point":[0.3618,0.0],"End Point":[0.3618,0.3618]},"line_3":{"Start Point":[0.3618,0.3618],"End Point":[0.0,0.3618]},"line_4":{"Start Point":[0.0,0.3618],"End Point":[0.0,0.0]}},"loop_2":{"line_1":{"Start Point":[0.0295,0.0264],"End Point":[0.3317,0.0264]},"line_2":{"Start Point":[0.3317,0.0264],"End Point":[0.3317,0.3354]},"line_3":{"Start Point":[0.3317,0.3354],"End Point":[0.0295,0.3354]},"line_4":{"Start Point":[0.0295,0.3354],"End Point":[0.0295,0.0264]}}}},"extrusion":{"extrude_depth_towards_normal":0.0264,"extrude_depth_opposite_normal":0.0,"sketch_scale":0.3618,"operation":"NewBodyFeatureOperation"}},"part_2":{"coordinate_system":{"Euler Angles":[0.0,0.0,0.0],"Translation Vector":[0.0,0.0,0.0264]},"sketch":{"face_1":{"loop_1":{"line_1":{"Start Point":[0.0,0.0],"End Point":[0.3618,0.0]},"line_2":{"Start Point":[0.3618,0.0],"End Point":[0.3618,0.0075]},"line_3":{"Start Point":[0.3618,0.0075],"End Point":[0.0075,0.0075]},"line_4":{"Start Point":[0.0075,0.0075],"End Point":[0.0075,0.3618]},"line_5":{"Start Point":[0.0075,0.3618],"End Point":[0.0,0.3618]},"line_6":{"Start Point":[0.0,0.3618],"End Point":[0.0,0.0075]},"line_7":{"Start Point":[0.0,0.0075],"End Point":[0.0,0.0]}}}},"extrusion":{"extrude_depth_towards_normal":0.7236,"extrude_depth_opposite_normal":0.0,"sketch_scale":0.3618,"operation":"JoinFeatureOperation"}}}}

prompt: <description>Part 1: Three-dimensional rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom, and a sloped side. Begin by creating a new coordinate system. Set the Euler angles to [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] and the translation vector to [0.0, 0.75, 0.0]. This will position and orient the coordinate system for the first part. Next, create a sketch on the X-Y plane of the new coordinate system. This sketch will consist of one face, face_1, and will be used to define the shape of the prism. On face_1, create loop_1 comprising the following lines: 1. Line_1: Start Point [0.0, 0.0], End Point [0.6153, 0.0] 2. Line_2: Start Point [0.6153, 0.0], End Point [0.6153, 0.4138] 3. Line_3: Start Point [0.6153, 0.4138], End Point [0.0, 0.4138] 4. Line_4: Start Point [0.0, 0.4138], End Point [0.0, 0.0] Since loop_1 forms a closed loop and consists only of lines, it is valid. After creating the sketch, transform it into a 3D sketch using the provided euler angles and translation vector. Finally, extrude the sketch along the Z-axis by 0.75 units to form the prism. The completed prism has the following dimensions: length = 0.6153, width = 0.75, and height = 0.6153. Part 2: Cylindrical object with a slightly tapered top Begin by creating a new coordinate system. Set the Euler angles to [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] and the translation vector to [0.0994, 0.2754, 0.4138]. Create a sketch on the X-Y plane of the new coordinate system. In this sketch, create a single face and on that face, create loop_1 comprising circle_1: 1. Circle_1: Center [0.1517, 0.1517], Radius 0.1517 Use the euler angles and translation vector to transform the sketch into a 3D sketch. Next, perform a cut extrusion operation. Extrude the sketch along the Z-axis by 0.8271 units, towards the opposite direction of normals, in order to create a cylindrical hole within the prism created in Part 1. The completed cylindrical hole has the following dimensions: length = 0.3033, width = 0.3033, and height = 0.8271. Upon completion, you'll have successfully created the designed three-dimensional rectangular prism with a cylindrical hole in the center. The dimensions of the prism are approximately 2 units in length, 1 unit in width, and 1 unit in height. The cylindrical hole has a diameter of approximately 0.5 units.</description>
completion:
<json>
{"parts":{"part_1":{"coordinate_system":{"Euler Angles":[0.0,0.0,-90.0],"Translation Vector":[0.0,0.75,0.0]},"sketch":{"face_1":{"loop_1":{"line_1":{"Start Point":[0.0,0.0],"End Point":[0.6153,0.0]},"line_2":{"Start Point":[0.6153,0.0],"End Point":[0.6153,0.4138]},"line_3":{"Start Point":[0.6153,0.4138],"End Point":[0.0,0.4138]},"line_4":{"Start Point":[0.0,0.4138],"End Point":[0.0,0.0]}}}},"extrusion":{"extrude_depth_towards_normal":0.75,"extrude_depth_opposite_normal":0.0,"sketch_scale":0.6153,"operation":"NewBodyFeatureOperation"}},"part_2":{"coordinate_system":{"Euler Angles":[0.0,0.0,0.0],"Translation Vector":[0.0994,0.2754,0.4138]},"sketch":{"face_1":{"loop_1":{"circle_1":{"Center":[0.1517,0.1517],"Radius":0.1517}}}},"extrusion":{"extrude_depth_towards_normal":0.0,"extrude_depth_opposite_normal":0.8271,"sketch_scale":0.3033,"operation":"CutFeatureOperation"}}}}
</json>

prompt: <description>Part 1: Construct a rectangular prism with a sloped side Step 1: Create a new coordinate system Create a new coordinate system with the following properties: - Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] - Translation Vector: [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] Step 2: Draw the 2D sketch for the base Draw a 2D sketch on the X-Y plane of the new coordinate system with the following components: - Face 1 - Loop 1 - Line 1: Start Point [0.0, 0.0], End Point [0.75, 0.0] - Line 2: Start Point [0.75, 0.0], End Point [0.75, 0.125] - Line 3: Start Point [0.75, 0.125], End Point [0.125, 0.125] - Line 4: Start Point [0.125, 0.125], End Point [0.125, 0.25] - Line 5: Start Point [0.125, 0.25], End Point [0.0, 0.25] - Line 6: Start Point [0.0, 0.25], End Point [0.0, 0.0] Step 3: Extrude the 2D sketch to 3D Extrude the 2D sketch along the Z-axis to a depth of 0.375 (opposite normal direction) with a uniform scaling factor of 0.75. This creates a 3D solid with a uniform gray color, with the following dimensions: length = 0.75, width = 0.375, height = 0.75. The top and bottom faces are flat, and the side face has a 45-degree slope along the Z-axis. Part 2: Construct a rectangular prism with a triangular cutout Step 1: Create a new coordinate system Create a new coordinate system with the following properties: - Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] - Translation Vector: [0.125, 0.125, 0.125] Step 2: Draw the 2D sketch for the base Draw a 2D sketch on the X-Y plane of the new coordinate system with the following components: - Face 1 - Loop 1 - Line 1: Start Point [0.0, 0.0], End Point [0.625, 0.0] - Line 2: Start Point [0.625, 0.0], End Point [0.625, 0.125] - Line 3: Start Point [0.625, 0.125], End Point [0.0, 0.125] - Line 4: Start Point [0.0, 0.125], End Point [0.0, 0.0] Step 3: Extrude the 2D sketch to 3D Extrude the 2D sketch along the Z-axis by 0.125 units in the normal direction with a uniform scaling factor of 0.625. This creates a 3D solid with a uniform gray color, with the following dimensions: length = 0.625, width = 0.625, height = 0.125. The part intersects with the previous part to form a rectangular prism with a triangular cutout on one of its faces.</description>

prompt: <description>**CAD Assembly Instructions** **Part 1: Base Part - Cylindrical Object with a Rectangular Prism on Top** 1. **Create a new coordinate system** with the following properties: * Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] * Translation Vector: [0.0, 0.4778, 0.0] 2. **Draw the 2D sketch for the base part** on the X-Y plane of the coordinate system. 3. **Create the first face (face_1)** and draw a **circle (circle_1)** on it: * Center: [0.2966, 0.2966] * Radius: 0.2966 4. **Create the second face (face_2)** and draw the **rectangular prism** on it using lines: * Line 1: Start Point: [0.0228, 0.6046], End Point: [0.5703, 0.6046] * Line 2: Start Point: [0.5703, 0.6046], End Point: [0.5703, 0.75] * Line 3: Start Point: [0.5703, 0.75], End Point: [0.0228, 0.75] * Line 4: Start Point: [0.0228, 0.75], End Point: [0.0228, 0.6046] 5. **Close the loop and faces** to complete the 2D sketch. The rectangular prism has 4 lines and the circle has 1 line representing the circumference of the circle. 6. **Scale the 2D sketch using the sketch_scale parameter**: 0.75 7. **Transform the scaled 2D sketch into 3D Sketch** using the Euler angles and translation vector from the coordinate system. 8. **Extrude the 2D sketch along the normal direction** by 0.4778 units, creating the 3D model of the cylindrical object with the rectangular prism on top. **Final Shape: A 3D model of a cylindrical object with a rectangular prism on top.** - Shape: Cylinder with a Rectangular Prism - Length: 0.75 units - Width: 0.4778 units - Height: 0.75 units</description>
